title: [UX] Ctrl+P model selector blocked by non-empty input
description: User reports Ctrl+P doesn't work if input box has text; must delete message to change model. Investigate TUI key handling so Ctrl+P works regardless of input.

logs.msg: Ctrl+P currently routes to history when input non-empty (see src/tui/events.rs: Ctrl+P handler). User wants provider picker even with input present.
Changed Ctrl+P to always open provider selector when not running (history via Up/Down).
Selector close now avoids clearing scrollback to prevent extra blank lines; added flag to skip \x1b[3J on selector exit.
Line/scrollback audit not done yet; only selector newline fix applied earlier. User asked for review of similar line handling bugs later.
